page.title: 01Hills of North Devon
page.content: The entire block is hilly farming land sparsley populated. The ground rises between 400ft to over 1000ft in places and none of the fields are flat. Farms are small family concerns employing little or no outside labour. Mostly sheep graze outside all year round, but some are over-wintered under cover feeding on hay and silage. Cattle are reared for beef, there is no arable farming. The water treatment works in Station Road provides employment for two or three men who live on the site. About six times a year point-to-point races are held on the race course east of the road at Stowford Cross and are very popular with local people. South Stowford Farm is the Exmoor Bird Gardens and attracts many holiday visitors to the see exotic birds and smalll animals. It is owned by two families who live on the premises.
